snippet: Afghan security forces would undergo a significant reduction to about 230,000 personnel after the NATO mission ends in 2014.
abstract: Afghan government and the international coalition paying for the war effort agree in principle that Afghan security forces will undergo a significant reduction to about 230,000 personnel after the NATO mission ends in 2014.

byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker reported from Washington, and Alissa J. Rubin from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Afghan security forces would undergo a significant reduction to about 230,000 personnel after the NATO mission ends in 2014.

headline.seo: Afghan Force Will Be Cut as NATO Ends Mission in 2014
headline.main: Afghan Force Will Be Cut After Taking Leading Role
headline.print_headline: Afghan Force Will Be Cut After Taking Leading Role

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
